title: Introduction to foreign trade
creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
brief_description: First establishes the importance of foreign trade to the economy and then presents a general picture of the mechanics of international commerce. The role of monetary standards and control, national policies in reference to those controls, distribution of raw materials and markets are shown. Then, in an actual exchange of goods, the detailed domestic and foreign operations involved in the sale, shipment and payment are protrayed.
